data.title: Lots of crab but no crawfish
data.text:
Camera here with a couple of friends to try their crawfish unfortunately it was no season so we went for crabs instead.

They serve it all in a big bowl together with corn and sausages sounds a strange mix but it was excellent prices are also reasonable with only 4$ for a beer.

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: I came here with a friend that was in town for the weekend. We were both craving seafood so we looked up what was in the area and saw that the reviews here were great so we went for it. We had two lbs. of shrimp and 1 lb. of crab legs. It was AMAZING! The waiter was great and made our time there very pleasant. It was very clean and I loved the hand washing on the table feature! Its a little pricey but you definitely get what you paid for! I will definitely be back with family and friends.

data.title: Fantastic food
data.text:
Pleasantly surprised!! Great food great value!!! Awesome
Service. 😀 we will definitely be back again.

data.title: Great sea food
data.text: Very interesting concept. Excellent food, little salty for my taste. And you eat with your hands. I loved it. The left over they put in the plastic bag, which is a great idea.

data.title: Simple and Great Food
data.text:
Went with my family on a Sunday afternoon. The place is just perfect in size and it is very casual. The service was fast and good.
They have an option of three combos that brings a little bit of everything. We chose combo # three. It brings a pound of each; Clams, crawfish, shrimp and crab legs. It also comes with corn on the cob, bread and steamed potatoes. Make sure to order it with the Torpedo sauce.

Also try the sweet potato fries.

Its nice to have a place in Pembroke Pines that is willing to try something different, to what we are usually accustomed to in the area.

data.title: Great take out
data.text: Picked up a couple of pounds of shrimp in torpedo sauce. As always, it was hot, spicy and lots of great flavor. It has tons of garlic and Cajun spices. It is well worth to have it with bread as there is plenty of spice on the shrimp.

data.title: Mediocre..
data.text: .....The concept is good and the quality of the seafood is pretty good too, but....I went on a Wednesday evening and they have not resupplied the restaurant from the previous weekend. Lame. No shrimp cracker snacks and no soda crackers to accompany the raw oysters. The oysters while fresh and tasty were served in a manner that they were full of water from the ice. All of the oyster's "milk" was washed out of the shell. Also, the waiter made several mistakes on our orders quantities and was slow at bringing implements to eat the seafood with. Mediocre

data.title: Awsome Losuisiana Style fresh Seafood
data.text: This place is great for fresh seafood Cajun Louisiana seafood.. try their combos...great prices too. We had the pasta seafood, a combo of lobster tails with fresh crawfish bowls and corn on the cob.

data.title: Good Seafood pasta
data.text: The restaurant just opened. Crawfish was ok. The pasta was very good. We also had the Cajun rice. Service was good. Plenty of parking.

data.title: Great Cajun food!
data.text: Was very surprised how good this was.  The shrimp and crawfish were well seasoned and very good.  Get ready to get your hands messy.  They provide you with a bib and you can put the seafood on the table to eat.  Had a great time with friends.

data.title: Best Snow crabs legs
data.text: Came here for the first time for a to go order but when my kids saw the menu we decided to eat in. When we were seated we were given shrimp chips.The snow crab legs are wonderful! I had it in the mild torpedo sauce which gave them a great taste (it was awesome on the shrimp chips also). I look forward to trying the rest of the menu items, very good seafood

data.title: Nice lunch
data.text: Came here for lunch and really enjoyed it. The shrimp in the torpedo spices was excellent. The prices are fair since you are purchasing peel and eat by the pound. I would recommend trying it and I know that we will be back soon.

data.title: Fruta do mar
data.text:
Se voce gosta de um prato de Louisiana um pouco picante com bastante alho.
Esse e o lugar. Um prato para duas pessoas por $50 dolares. Com lagostra, camarao grande, milho e batatinha cozida num molho picante, uma delicia. So uma coisa nao se usa talhares, come com as maos.
